column4: Hi, i'm running Ubuntu 7.10 on my  Dell Inspiron 1501, I love it, but if I go on my ACCU, its really going fast down, any ideas how to reduce the accu's going down so fast??
Hi, i'm running Ubuntu 7.10 on my  Dell Inspiron 1501, I love it, but if I go on my ACCU, its really going fast down, any ideas how to reduce the accu's going down so fast??
I also have a dell 1501 running 7.10. Have you got wireless working at full speed or is it still at 24mb/s
I don't think it working at full speed, if I go to the upper floor, I don't get any internet at all!
what drivers do you use for your wireless card?
I am using the restricted drivers as ubuntu suggests
same here...
i'm glad it works tho
i've used SLED with my dell as well and after a bit of tweaking the wireless works full speed
do you have it at full speed now?
not in ubuntu 7.10
ic
you think there will be upgrades soon or anything?
i'm giving up on it...just going to run xp on it i think
where can I see the speed of the wireless?
by right clicking on the wireless icon in the right hand corner i think
hit connection information
your right, 24mbit here to :(
not nice to say on ubuntu chat but try suse 10.3 or SLED
but this is so pretty :)
if you want pretty suse is right up there
